intro: Acriopsis gracilis, commonly known as the slender cowparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges. Acriopsis gracilis is often mistaken for other similar species due to its delicate appearance and growth habits.
